intro: Cecropia telealbida, commonly known as the white-veined cecropia, is a fast-growing tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, alternate, elliptical leaves with prominent white veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. Cecropia telealbida plays an important role in supporting biodiversity, providing food and shelter for various insects and birds.
